txt: Local schools should help make up the pension fund crisis by learning to live with budget cuts.
University management bears more responsibility than federal and state education funding cuts for tuition rising so much over the years.
Officials that use social media accounts in a professional capacity should not be allowed to block constituents except under rare conditions like being threatened.
I should be able to vote in city elections if I pay city taxes, even though I may live in the county.
Most local officials run for office to serve the public good.
Local law enforcement would benefit from additional training in community relations.
Most journalists strive to be factual and unbiased, whether or not they succeed in all their writing,
Opinion pieces without a specific author make it more confusing to determine whether a media source is biased or not.
The fact that there is not as much coverage about African American deaths due to cocaine as there is about deaths in the white community from opioids is evidence of institutionalized racism.
Harsher sentences for drug users would help combat the opioid epidemic.
In order to better combat the opioid epidemic, it is time to view drug addiction as a health problem rather than a criminal justice problem.
Law enforcement should send drug possession arrestees for rehabilitation services rather than imprisonment.
Medical marijuana should be legal.
Recreational marijuana should be legal.
I regularly discuss politics with people I disagree with.
WKU and local community colleges should continue to offer courses that interest those seeking an education, whether or not the courses aid in job placement.
The main purpose of higher education is job training.
If private schools were to get a share of Federal or State education dollars, it would hurt public schools.
Beautification projects and other quality-of-life enhancements like parks and libraries help attract new residents and industries to our city/county.
More nonviolent inmates convicted of drug possession should be set free.
It is embarrassing that our city is the largest in the state not to have a fairness ordinance.
The arts are an important component of K-12 education.
Crime is worse in Bowling Green / Warren County than it was a decade ago.
No child should go hungry in Bowling Green / Warren County, and it is up to our officials to make sure it doesn’t happen.
No family should be homeless in Bowling Green / Warren County, and it is up to our officials to make sure they have options for shelter.
Homelessness is for the nonprofit sector to deal with, not government.
A city should have the right to declare itself a sanctuary city.
Our immigrant communities have, overall, been a benefit to our city and county.
Cutting a major sports program would be the best way for WKU to deal with budget cuts without harming academics.

The fact that there is not as much coverage about African American deaths from cocaine as there is about deaths in the white community from opioids, even though there are as many of them, is evidence of institutionalized racism.
Our local immigrant population has, overall, been a benefit to our city and county.
We need a whole food store here.
We need a WHOLE FOOD store.
I would like to see part of the downtown area converted to an "art district". Something similar to the Wynnwood Walls in Miami, FL.
I would like to see more aid for the homeless whether: tiny house park, health clinic, rehabilitation, job readiness sources.
I would like to see more community art and music programs. For instance, I would love to sign up for a community choir.
I would like to see a revitalization of older parts of Bowling Green, by giving home improvement grants to home owners. Approval process req
More youth programs are needed to bring the community together: volunteer organizations, community service, innovative creations labs
All schools in the county and city should work together to provide the same minimum level of education to students.
All students in Warren county should have the best available education, not the Kentucky minimum, at all times.
If strict dress codes are required, uniforms should be provided by the school system, not eat into the  parents possibly small budget.
Fewer students per teacher should be a rule. No more than 20; ideal class size of 15. Plenty of teachers are looking for work.
If the state cannot provide good retirement benefits to KRS employees, the county/city should supplement the retirement with a 401k.
I would like to see the WKU psych and Medical programs collaborate on mental health research, which is so sadly lacking in today's society.
I would like to see a sift in city planning and zoning to make BG a more walkable city with better sidewalk planning
We already have a lot of parks. And the libraries have become a hangout for the homeless.  Do something about that problem first
I still have to drive out of town to eat Golden Corral.
Continue downtown development to the river.  Tourists always seek out parks & restaurants near water.
City should bar non-competes, similar to North Dakota/California, as driving destitution in non-tenure work force. Be heroic destination.
City should bar garbage token health plans designed to prevent temp services paying $166/month Obamacare emp. fee. Let ppl get subsidy.
A person should not miss rent (say due to a car breakdown) and face eviction in less than 2 weeks (before next payday). Make it 30 days.
City needs to bar big COs employing from half a dozen temp services to keep 100s ineligble for FMLA due to less than 50 ppl/per 'employer'
City needs to mandate temp services furnish details of how much they are selling employee labor for, to the employee.
Temp service need to pay higher hourly rate to temp than hiring firm pays their FTE to account for reduced economic security
Temp svc need to furnish the equivalent of FMLA, despite not having 50 people at one single site.
Every school has 1-9% homeless people. This is for the government to deal with via economic policy.  Not sending to a NGO or giving a shanty
We need more things to do for ages 1-6. A children’s museum or a small science museum would be wonderful.
We need a real bus system.
Something needs to be done with the river area- river walk, park, restaurants, summer events- to give the communities ways to get together.
We need more activities for families such a large scale all in one kids play arenas like All About Kids. We also need a health food store.
There isn’t enough here to draw young families. We need a beautification of the riverfront and a more walkable city for young professionals
Individuals should be treated equally. Higher positions or who you work for should not release anyone from responsibility of their actions.
11,000 Total American deaths from cocaine is not equal to 45,000 deaths from opoids, therefore false race-baiting news is a problem.
WKU should upgrade their CIT program to keep up with the times
More choices when it comes to internet.  BGMU has been offering service to businesses for a while, they should expand to offer to residents.
Prevent the development of new housing areas, especially in farm land areas.
The city should actually time stoplights correctly during rush hour to prevent complete gridlock
Some local politicians abuse their power and get away with more than normal citizens.
County volunteer fire departments need to be upgraded to fit the current population of Warren County.
Something needs to be done to improve traffic flow
More concerts should be held in Bowling Green
Greenwood Mall should be remodeled to attract more buyers.
We need more activities for families, such as a large-scale all-in-one kids play arena like All About Kids.
We need a health food store.
More advertising should be done along I-65 to promote tourism into Bowling Green.
Improve traffic flow throughout BG, specifically, Scottsville Rd. & consider with any proposed new developments.  Too many traffic lights.
Build and improve sidewalks in the area of Magnolia Street and 13th to Cabell Drive area for the heavy pedestrian traffic there.
Bring a discount grocer to the downtown area.
Bowling Green needs a fairness ordinance to attract new businesses. No one wants to set up show in a town ethically stuck in the 1800s.
Marijuana should be legalized. It would be a boon for the economy.
Warren County residents should not be charged the WASTE WATER SERVICE FEE on their water bills.
There are too many traffic lights in parts of Bowling Green (for instance, Scottsville Road).
Traffic flow needs to be improved throughout Bowling Green, especially on Scottsville Road.
Impact on traffic flow should be considered with any proposed new developments.
I would like to see Bowling Green become more walk-able. Look to Columbus, IN for ideas.
Legalizing marijuana would be a boon for the economy.
Bowling Green needs a fairness ordinance to protect the rights of its citizens.
A fairness ordinance in Bowling Green would attract new businesses. No one wants to set up show in a town ethically stuck in the 1800s.
The downtown district, especially Fountain Square, should have more retail businesses, not offices.
Marijuana should not be legalized.
LGBTQ fairness is far-left political idiocy.
People need to do all their research before accusing local officials of using their influence for personal gain.
Bowling Green needs more walk friendly areas and an expanded bus system.
Industrial hemp should be re-legalized to grow in Kentucky.
Warren county needs to be "wet". The city is wet but the county is dry.
Downtown at the square and adjacent areas should be a pedestrian mall
Law enforcement in Bowling Green and Warren county needs more minority representation
The lack of leadership regarding adequate planning and zoning in BG is discouraging.
Bowling Green needs to annex a solid geographic area & thereby eliminating those areas within our city that are not receiving city services.
Warren County should be completely wet, the idea of a “moist” County is outdated and stunting the financial growth and tourism opportunity.
Bowling Green & Warren Co. should consolidate into a metro.
We need jobs to attract our own college educated students so they don’t leave to get better paying jobs
A Fairness Ordinance.
Homeless people deserve full size places like studio apartments.  Not tiny homes like a smurf would desire in a tiny house park.
Downtown redevelopment should retain accessible parking for existing businesses.
City should pay 1.2-1.5m per annum for all homeless k-12 student/families a studio apartment at $500 or less. fund by occ tax move to 1.91%
If city eliminates homelessness via occupational taxes, employers of homeless people need to reimburse city via special occ. tax penalty
We are loosing the city’s long established neighborhoods to multi family developments that do not fit in with the single family residences
People wearing University of Kentucky gear should be banned from the city.
The city and county school systems should merge.
Trains blocking major roads, stopping, and shutting down all traffic. This problem needs to be solved.
City and county parks departments should provide more programming for adults and seniors.
Local government, for profit and non profits should work together on housing and economic equality
City/County schools should have a minimum one year classroom for immigrant and refugee students so they can learn english, culture and laws
Minimum wage required for businesses to receive tax credits should be raised to a living wage
The population has out grown the infrastructure in bg/ warren county.
Local elected government officials should not be able to hold a seat and also be on the TIF board or other unelected boards.
Merged city/county government should be considered.
Virtual civic assemblies allow online trolls to have influence in our community.
Graves Gilbert has created a healthcare monopoly within Bowling Green and the surrounding areas.
I’ve never been to Kentucky and have no idea why I’m allowed to participate in this.
KASPER is an invasion of privacy that contradicts what HIPAA regulations try to protect.
Driver’s education needs to be more thorough and mandatory before 16 year olds are even allowed to drive home from the courthouse.
Graves Gilbert staff members have reported sexual harassment in the workplace too many times for nothing to be done.
Human trafficking in Bowling Green needs to be investigated by the FBI before it becomes a larger problem swept under the rug.
My employer has not been responsive to reports of sexual harassment in the workplace.
City/county officials should disclose to the public via Daily News all connections they have to a project or proposal well before the vote.
City/County officials with connections to a project or proposal should abstain from voting on the project or proposal.
New developments should not be approved unless roads and infrastructure capable of handling them are in place.
Recreational Cannabis in KY offers tourism, increased revenue, job opportunities, and shows massive leadership in the southern region.
Only a traffic circle at Kereiakes Park on Fairview Ave. is required.
With a circle, widen Fairview with a left-turn lane west of cemetery.
Residents using septic tanks should not be charged for waste water.
The city needs to make McDonald's lower the cost of a Big Mac to $.50.
BGMU should introduce residential internet service to compete with Spectrum.
Cable companies need competition and not be allowed to raise rates of  customers. Once you sign on, that is your rate unless you upgrade.
The city should craft a very simple fairness ordinance, saying no discrimination acquiring housing, but not giving LGBTQ EEOC Bypass @work
Majority rule doesn't count if majority votes no to spending 6 cents per $100 to eliminate homelessness for hundreds of school children.
Publicizing more cultural activities other than the Bowling Green International Festival.
Bowling Green City Commission needs to pass an ordinance banning the sale or use of large fireworks in the city limits.
Big names and corporations get away with too much. We need fairer regulation and level playing fields for the small and big guys alike.
There are too many apartments being built. Our economy can't continue to support it. There will be a bust & it might be sooner than later.
There is not enough done for tourism in Warren Co. We offer much more than Corvettes and we should be promoting other activities.
You shouldn't be required to pay County taxes if you live in the City (but not the other way around). It makes no sense.
We should be incentivizing higher paying jobs coming to BG. Cost of living is outrunning wages and it's starting to be a problem.
There should be greater checks on our County and City executives. They don't wield too much power but they do wield far too much influence.
Our sidewalks need more connectivity. It's too piecemealed and makes some areas unusable.
The homeless population is getting out of hand. We need to find better methods for curtailing and rehabing and keeping them off the streets.
The access roads off Scottsville Rd are terrible. They provide constant traffic jams and can be dangerous. We need to budget to fix them.
Why isn't Nashville Rd between the roundabout and Campbell Ln wider? Getting stuck there at 5 o'clock is a plague.
We need look for a Natcher connection on Three Springs or Elrod Rd
We should think about moving the airport. Too much high dollar land going to waste right now.
There is too much continuous road work going on downtown. They need to get it together.
The Old Morgantown Rd train crossing needs either an underpass or an overpass
Every railroad crossing needs an elevating arm. Too many near accidents for something so inexpensive.
We need to promote competition in town for Charter. AT&T isn't much better and doesn't serve everywhere. Need more fiber to the homes.
The intersection at Taco Bell and KFC is a nightmare
We need more businesses like White Squirrel and Nats in BG. They add character to our town. Done with the Olive Garden and Belks.
SKYPAC needs to bring in younger, more entertaining acts. It will fall apart if they keep only catering to 50+. Could be a great venue.
We need to commit more resources to the North-Northeast ends of town. Blue collar people who help make Bowling Green what is. Too neglected.
There is no reason not to spend 6 cents per $100 to eliminate homelessness for hundreds of school children.
We should have some riverwalk like Owensboro has. Would embrace Bowling Green's character and provide place for City activities.
Like Steamers but hate they ruined that historic building
Need more bike lanes and biker friendly resources
Cops are overzealous in BG. So little crime they try to create trouble. Need to ease off. This city is plenty safe.
Wish the airport would get better flights. WheelsUp was cool but need more locations. Sad Owensboro is so far ahead there.
Why on earth is the road closed between Shawnee and Patton Way? Getting from there to Nashville Rd takes 3 times as long.
Unelected school board officials should not have the power to create, add, or increase "school taxes".
When resurfacing a roadway, attention should be given to making the manhole covers level with the new surface.
Arcade Bar
Bowling Green should pass the Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act (or URLTA) to ensure basic standards for landlords and tenants.
Bowling Green should spend less time redoing the same sidewalks over and over again and focus on the areas that actually need improvement.
The road closure between Shawnee and Patton Way makes access to Nashville Rd take 3 times as long and is a major annoyance.
A second Chick-fil-A should be built at the entrance of South Glen Gables across from South Warren High School
Bowling Green needs stricter code enforcement on property use and condition in some neighborhoods.
Please pass a Fairness Ordinance!
Enact rent control laws to stabilize the constant increase in rates.
People in Bowling Green should not be discriminated against based on their sexual orientation.
It would be great if people in neighborhoods could get to know each other better and neighborhoods were like small communities of neighbors.
Zoning changes should only be made with the consent of a majority of the neighbors in the affected area.
Bowling Green needs Community Enrichment Classes that include woodworking, welding, gardening and general home beautification for hobbyist.
The university and city should develop stronger mutually beneficial partnerships.
The arts enrich our city.
We should focus downtown development dollars on rehabilitation and reuse of buildings that can be done so, rather than building new.
Install new sidewalks along major roads, like Three Springs, and city-wide bike routes, to decrease likelihood of accidents
Refugee neighbors enrich our city's landscape and we should find more ways to welcome and integrate them into the life of the city.
Time the traffic lights correctly.
Better incorporation of university resources in community, including Kentucky Museum.
Better ordinances on keeping animals on leashes or in fenced areas. Relaxed restrictions on fencing in HOAs to promote it.
Encourage local business development with grants, etc. For a city this size, it is ridiculous that we have basically one local coffee shop!
Institute a business development grant that encourages WKU grads to stay in Bowling Green by starting local businesses.
Increase green spaces, especially near mall, to decrease congestion and improve "green" status
Require new downtown developments to become LEED certified
A favorite place to visit (elsewhere) is a park filled with gently used toys (donated).  It inspires imagination, creativity and sharing.
More choices when it comes to internet. BGMU has been offering service to businesses for a while, they should expand to offer to residents.
Bowling Green needs far more bike paths AND to put sidewalks along Gary Farms Blvd
Bowling Green needs to attract business like Costco and Trader Joe's to keep residents from driving to Nashville on weekends
Bowling Green needs a Fairness Ordinance.
Bowling Green needs more competitive cable and internet rates.
Bowling Green needs to enforce the separation of church and state and impose taxes on churches that politic from the pulpit
Bowling Green needs more competitive cable rates.
Bowling Green needs more competitive internet rates.
Residential Parking Permits for areas near WKU. We can rescue our yards from parking. We pay property taxes for the students' convenience,
Sidewalks are needed along Gary Farms Blvd
Why has the Police stop enforcing parking regulations? Park any way any direction. Is it time for a separate Traffic Enforcement Division?
Refugees and immigrants are welcome next door.
Better ordinances on keeping animals on leashes or in fenced areas are needed.
Relax restrictions on fencing in Home Owners Associations to promote people keeping animals on leashes or in fenced yards.
BG has a bad problem with littering.  My husband and I fill up to 5 recycle bins every week between downtown and campus, cleaning it all up.
Traffic improvement on the so-called Bypass.  Most cities actually have a bypass.  Bowling Green doesn't have one.
Someone needs to recruit Aldi to build a store on Nashville Road next to SWHS to serve the growing neighborhoods in the area.
BG/WC won't be able to do much because so much of this forum is full of crap that has nothing to do with city/county governments.
Leash laws should be more strictly enforced in both the city and county
We need to make it worthwhile for builders to create more quality affordable rental units for residents, rather than more luxury units.
More bike trails and walking trails would be a great addition.
A clean, efficient public transportation system would be a huge help to those with limited ability or desire to drive.
A second Chick-fil-A location should be built at the entrance of South Glen Gables across from South Warren High School.
A fairness ordinance and implementation of tenant's rights would make this community more progressive and fair.
Developing more bike trails into surrounding areas of the city would allow for a more developed both transport and recreational experiences
New home zoning should be for single family dwellings rather than multi-family units (apartments).
Stronger tenant and renters rights. Landlord accountability for keeping properties in good shape. So many overpriced dilapidated rentals.
Bowling Green's refugee, immigrant, and international student population improves the university and the community.
Develop the Greenway so that the paved trail is continuous and reaches major parts of the city including the square, WKU, GM, and others.
Rent is too expensive inside the city limits.
More food options (Chick-fil-A, Wendy's or Steak 'n Shake, etc) would be nice at the entrance of South Glen Gables on Nashville Road.
I would love to see a Texas Roadhouse in Bowling Green
The WKU Nursing Program should be expanded so we have more nurses
We need to block left turns on the busy parts of the by-pass so people don't block everyone else trying to turn.
We need to grow the internet infrastructure particularly in growing areas of the county like Alvaton.
Internet services should be a public municipality.
The Fairness Ordinance, as currently proposed, poses insufficient protection for religious conscience and should be revised accordingly.
Bowling Green has many excellent non-public schools; more should be done to make these options available to diverse and low-income families.
City had 109 homeless students in 2017, County Had 112.  Housing those families temporarily is worth raising tax rate from 1.85% to 1.91%.
7% of Paker-Bennett &  3.7% of Bristow homeless. I will pay 6 cents per $100 income to end homelessness for school-age families via Apt. $
2015-2016 Budget included 42 Million in occupational taxes.  Take it to 43.5 million, $500 rent for student homeless fam. @ 1.91% occ. tax
Better public transport. Actually teach HS students useful things. Legalize medical marijuana. Invest in the youth.
Actually teach HS students useful things.
Invest in the youth.

Graves Gilbert doctors order too many tests.
District judges are biased towards large local companies to the detriment of individuals.
We need to focus more on the existing housing in BG, including renovations and improvements.
Rental property taxes should be reduced for private landlords to encourage them to develop more, as opposed to large ones like Chandler.
Funding and support should be given to the existing BG buses, to expand their service area and improve accessibility.
Develop a manufacturing Work training program for jail inmates that qualify
With jails crowded, it seems many are first time offenders of crimes that hurt no one, nor property. Seems rehab would be better.
Some local doctors order too many tests.
competition for cable companies and an end to heir price gouging.
Shopping should be spread across all four corners of the county, so the traffic on Scottsville rd and Campbell lane will be improved.
we pay taxes but we dont get a force

Make it a walking city. Sidewalks along the main avenues (scottsville rd, campbell ln, 31 bypass) with plants, benches, art pieces.
Develop sidewalks and bike paths. Create neighborhoods where people likes to socialize. Encourage local businesses, restaurants and cafes.
We need en efficient public transportation system.
Bring Trader Joe's to BG!

BG needs more Summer weekend festivals/activities

employers  if there was a law pay back on bad lay off and cut back
big projeck in city sould be vote by people

if there was a law for employers to pay back on bad layoffs and cutbacks
city officials might look into layoff practices on jobs in bowling green ky

The feeder road at Shive Lane and Scottsville Road need to be closed off. It is very dangerous.
Bowling Green needs a fairness ordinance to protect the community against discrimination
Many drivers fail to stop as traffic lights turn red.  As many as 3 cars will travel through an intersection after light has changed to red.
Driving in this town very dangerous, Drivers Education classes should be required for all new drivers!!!
Get rid of anonymous submissions to cut back on the malarkey in here.

The entire bypass area is an eyesore and there needs to be a concerted effort like a TIF to revitalize this crucial part of town.
parks and rec should promote and support pickleball for older citizens
If it were remodeled, it shouldn’t be by tax dollars because it is not owned by the city or county.
If we cut a major program, WKU would lose in the revenue the program brings in, ultimately costing more money.

Drivers Education classes should be required!!!
Spectrum should have competition and not a monopoly. Rates should be regulated by city county government

There are way too many lights along Scottsville Road, and it negatively impacts traffic flow at all times of day.

We need Drivers Education to be required to get a license, our drivers are terrible, and more officers observing intersections.

Recycling center moved out of town.
The money I earn & spend is all done within the city limits but as a county resident I have NO voice/vote in city politics. Needs to change!

Planning & Zoning need to do a better job of listening & working with residents. It's not next to their house, so they don't care!
Recycling services need to be expanded & improved. With growing population, think of how much land will become dump sites...Ridiculous!
Strongly agree. Not passing Fairness shows contempt & a failure to protect 15% of our citizens.

Truly. Doubt it. If true erase it. Prohibition ended years ago.
Trickle down never works.
Work needs to be done on improving litter pick up and encouraging people dispose of their litter correctly.

Bowling Green needs to address its litter problem.  A little effort on everyone's part would class up our city.
There should be more officers observing intersections.
Recycling centers should be moved out of town.

Local food and small farms are one of BG best attractions.
Go to underground utilities. Scottsville rd and the by-pass look awful.
Footbridge from airport to across the street. Pilots running across the road.

Already have a good one on the by-pass.

Money is the issue and the governor & state legislators are to blame.
With drug use being so prevalent in Warren county, better treatment options need to be offered.
Marijuana should be legalized and taxed.
Excellent Survey Form.
city needs to work on water run off when we have a lot of rain.. to many places flood on roadways makes driving very dangerous..

People want it all, without paying for anything. A healthy community requires taxes people.
Keep expanding the Greenways to encourage pedestrian, cycling and other outdoor activity.
Give thought to traffic flow as more businesses and residences are being built
want to get more  into the city

The airport should be moved to the transpark.
Houston "courtesy police" maintain safety on access rds enforcing right of way & parking/litter rules, assist traffic flow - we need!
We need an NBA team. I think we should put the arena where the airport is. Think about it.
Casinos. Bring them here.
I think we have enough restaurants.
I wish we had train service to Nashville
An unmanned trolley system, possibly solar, might be better long term than buses for some areas.
There should never be a leash law in the county - neighborhood dogs protect, play with and teach kids. It was a factor in living in county.
Trick or treating should last longer after dark. Many decorations don't show til then. Also start later, parents can't get home in time!
Traffic is number one problem in Bowling Green
City School taxes are too high , they need to budget more
BG Parks needs more funding  from City
Apartments are being built all over town, but they are not affordable for the average single person not wanting to live near campus.
Junking up highways/roadways with signs should not be the primary way tourism is promoted.
Our city is not friendly to pedestrian and bike traffic. More should be done to make it safe and easy to get around on foot and bicycles.
Too many trees have been torn down to make way for new developments. We should re-plant more trees around Bowling Green.
Upgrade to Nashville Rd past roundabout 4-lane is in the state road plan
It seems like every time I go to this site its the same statements starting over again.

Bowling Green is an excellent place to raise a family, shop, worship, get an education, and recreate. I feel safe in most places here in BG.
Too many drivers don’t understand stoplight intersections-If you can’t make it all the way across, don’t leave the intersection.
The Smokey Bones entrance off of  scottsville Road is extremely dangerous. Needs bet get lighting
Traffic flow and better timing of traffic lights . One gets through one light only to have to stop at the next.
